quotes.quote: They seemed to be staring at the dark, but their eyes were watching God.
You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
You can know who a person is simply by staring into their eyes.
It was like staring at a whitewashed wall, but without all the emotion.
The gaze that sees is the gaze that dominates.
There are times when those eyes inside your brain stare back at you.
A stare is really nothing more than what you're thinking inside.
Staring at the blue sky causes insomnia to occur in the human.
Life is becoming no more than staring at the screen.
You are an artist. The canvas is your life. Make something worth staring at.
The ears that gape after secrets retain not faithfully what is entrusted to them.
Who is staring at the sea is already sailing a little.
People will stare. Make it worth their while.
Sometimes facing opportunity is like staring at the knees of a giraffe.
It's best not to stare at the sun during an eclipse.
Staring down hard truth takes guts.
People who stare deserve the looks they get.
If you stare into the Abyss long enough the Abyss stares back at you.
Stare, pry, listen, eavesdrop. Die knowing something. You are not here long.
No matter how much you keep encouraging someone who is blindfolded to stare through the cloth, he still won’t see a thing.
I like intelligent women. When you go out, it shouldn't be a staring contest.
Human beings cling to their delicious tyrannies and to their exquisite nonsense, till death stares them in the face.
It is not enough to stare up the steps, we must step up the stairs.
The writer should never be ashamed of staring. There is nothing that does not require his attention.
Sometimes we stare so long at a door that is closing that we see too late the one that is open.
Staring at the blank page before you, Open up the dirty window, Let the sun illuminate the words that you could not find.
Concentration is not staring hard at something. It is not trying to concentrate.
because we are always staring at the stars, we learn the shortness of our arms.
That little white ball is always staring back at you, daring you to make a mistake.
The end of a gun looks very big and very back when it's staring you in the face.
